title: Cuba plunged into darkness as electrical grid suffers fresh collapse
byline: Cuba’s energy grid has collapsed, leaving millions without power, the latest in a series of failures on an island struggling from creaking infrastructure, natural disasters and economic turmoil.

title: One million coconuts to be distributed through Sathosa outlets: Minister
byline: Steps are being taken to distribute one million coconuts through Sathosa outlets at a price of Rs. 130 each within the next two weeks, Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development Wasantha Samarasinghe said today.

title: President meets ITAK MPs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with Parliamentarians from the Illankai Tamil Arasu Katchchi (ITAK) today at the Presidential Secretariat, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Government Policy Statement passed in Parliament without a vote
byline: The resolution on the Statement of the Government Policy presented by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in Parliament on November 21 was passed unanimously in Parliament today without a vote.

title: Half a coconut selling at Rs. 120
byline: Due to a shortage of coconuts in the country, it is reported that half a coconut is being sold at a price between Rs. 100 and Rs. 120.

title: Experts convene to Colombo to discuss hate speech law reforms
byline: A workshop titled “A Pathway to Reform: Examining Hate Speech Laws in Sri Lanka” was recently held at the Mandarin Hotel in Colombo, bringing together legal experts, academics, and stakeholders.

title: Vote on Account presented to Parliament
byline: The vote on account through which the government is seeking Parliament’s approval to spend Rs. 1,403 billion (Rs. 1,402,886,263,000) from January 1, 2025, to April 30, 201,4 was presented to Parliament by Deputy Minister of Economic Development Anil Jayantha a short while ago.

title: CID arrests SLPP Administrative Secretary
byline: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) arrested Renuka Perera, the Administrative Secretary of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) this morning.

title: French government collapses in no-confidence vote
byline: The French government has collapsed after Prime Minister Michel Barnier was ousted in a no-confidence vote.

title: Excise suspends production licence of W. M. Mendis and Co.
byline: Despite several warnings issued over a span of one year, which were not being adhered to, the Department of Excise yesterday suspended the production licence of local liquor giant W. M. Mendis and Co. Limited for evading tax arrears of Rs.5.5 billion to the government, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Rs.10 coin found during autopsy of Digadanthu 1
byline: During the post-mortem examination of Digadanthu 1, wildlife officers found a Rs. 10 coin in its abdomen, Wildlife Conservation Department veterinary surgeon Dr. Chandana Jayasinghe said.

title: Special operations to target alcohol, drug use during Sripada pilgrimage
byline: Special operations have been planned to arrest individuals and groups who bring alcoholic beverages and drugs during the Sripada pilgrimage season starting this year, Hatton Police Superintendent Pradeep Weerasekara said.

title: Fair weather across most areas, showers in North, East
byline: Fair weather will prevail in most parts of the country today, but showers are expected in the Northern and Eastern Provinces as well as the Anuradhapura district, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Sri Lanka possibly losing two-thirds  of border tax revenue due to corruption, says Shippers’ Council
byline: The Sri Lanka Shippers’ Council claimed that the government coffers could be losing as much as two-thirds of potential border tax revenue, due to corrupt activities by the officials in key border agencies.

title: Legislations soon to recover stolen assets, deter money laundering: Justice Minister
byline: The government is planning to present three Bills in Parliament within the first quarter of this year, aiming to recover stolen assets, deter money laundering, drug trafficking and related vices, Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara said today.

title: Govt. Analyst’s Department’s Central Information Unit not functioning for four months
byline: Deputy Solicitor General Madhawa Thennakoon informed court that the Central Information Unit of the Government Analyst’s Department has not been functioning for four months and that it was not possible to obtain any reports.

title: 78 railway engines in need of repairs idling in running sheds
byline: The Auditor General’s Department has reported that 78 railway engines that needs repairs are idling in the running sheds and the Ratmalana Main Railway Workshop without attention for seven years since 2017.

title: Concerns raised over shortage of several drugs in hospitals
byline: The Health Ministry is grappling with a shortage of multiple drugs, including several essential drugs, a senior official said.

title: No legal issues over farmers taking actions against wild animals within their own lands: Minister
byline: Farmers can take any action regarding damages to crops by wild animals within their cultivated lands, Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation Lal Kantha said today.

title: Bitcoin surges past $100k for first time
byline: The price of Bitcoin has for the first time broken past the $100,000 mark, hitting a new record high.

title: No shortage of coconuts, mafia created: Minister
byline: Claiming that there is no shortage of coconut in the country, Trade Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe said today there is an attempt to create an artificial shortage in the market.

title: USAID, CBL group to boost SL’s coconut industry
byline: CBL Global Foods Limited (CBL GFL), a subsidiary of the CBL Group, in partnership with the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) this week released a practical handbook to improve coconut farming practices in Sri Lanka.

title: Schoolchildren lose their way during Hanthana excursion
byline: A group of schoolchildren from Colombo, who were on an excursion to Hanthana mountains during the school vacation and had lost their way, were rescued by the police and the army.

title: Lohan Ratwatte and his wife granted bail
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte and his wife Shashi Prabha Ratwatte were granted bail by the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Most lunch boxes, water bottles unfit to store food for children
byline: Most lunch boxes and water bottles available in the local market are not suitable for children to store their food, Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union Chairman Upul Rohana said.

title: Obtain Parliamentary approval for Debt Sustainability Agreement with ISB holders: Opposition MP
byline: The Government should obtain Parliamentary approval for the debt sustainability agreement with international sovereign bond (ISB) holders before implementing it, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Kabir Hashim told Parliament today.

title: Unknown flu-like disease kills at least 79 people in DR Congo
byline: At least 79 people have died from an unknown disease that is causing flu-like symptoms in south-western Democratic Republic of Congo, the health ministry says.

title: Sri Lanka and South Africa look to keep WT Final hopes alive
byline: South Africa will take on Sri Lanka in the second Test of the twomatch series at St. George’s Park in Gqeberha, starting today.
